entityId.localType: State Records Office of Western Australia Reference code

nameEntry.part: EM Hall. Dulhi-Gunyah Orphanage. Report for year ending 30th June 1914

biogHist.abstract: EM Hall. Dulhi-Gunyah Orphanage. Report for year ending 30th June 1914 contains the year-end report from the Australian Aborigines Mission for Dulhi Gunyah for 1913-1914. It reports on the number of children for whom government 'maintenance' payments were received.
biogHist.p: Access to these records is open but you will need to put in a request to see the file.

The report shows there were 12 girls and four boys, aged from one month to fifteen years. The children came from different parts of the State: Katanning (6 children, who had returned to Carrolup during the year), Busselton, Albany; one child from Fremantle and another from Onslow; and an infant who had been found 'abandoned' in King's Park. The report said that children were mostly from Nyungar lands and some spoke only their local languages when they arrived at Dulhi Gunyah. It was also reported that 24 children were enrolled in school at Dulhi Gunyah, with a teacher whose salary was paid by the Education Department. Children were not able to access the local state school. The emphasis of the curriculum was on 'skills that would lead to laboring and domestic work'.
